awd_titl_txt: Subsonic Wind Tunnel for Undergraduate Engineering          Instruction
awd_abstract_narration: The primary objective of the proposed project is to enhance the                 laboratory experience of undergraduate engineering students,                    especially mechanical engineering students, studying fluid                      mechanics and general laboratory instrumentation by introducing                 them to a state-of-the-art subsonic wind tunnel with ancillary                  pressure, flow and force transducers. A second objective is to                  acquaint non-science majors with fundamental principles of                      fluid mechanics via experimentation as a component of two newly                 developed introductory courses. In addition, the strong appeal                  of model aircraft aerodynamic testing will be exploited to                      attract local minority junior and senior high school students                   to engineering via a special minority engineering program.
